standard.description: These tests help support Accessibility standards. They are not substitutes for screen reader tests and other manual tests.

test.test_name: Pages should avoid hardcoding tab indexes
test.query_clob:
with aap as (
    select case
         when lower(trim(dialog_attributes)) like '%tabindex%' 
         then 'N' 
         else 'Y'
         end pass_yn,
       page_id,
       page_name,
       application_id,
       dialog_attributes,
       created_by,
       created_on,
       last_updated_by,
       last_updated_on,
       build_option,
       page_mode,
	     workspace
    from apex_application_pages)
select aap.pass_yn,                          
       aap.application_id, 
       aap.page_id,
       aap.created_by,
       aap.created_on,
       aap.last_updated_by,
       aap.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Page `%0` (app %1, page %2) has a hardcoded tab index: `%3`', 
        p0 => aap.page_name, 
        p1 => aap.application_id,
        p2 => aap.page_id,
				p3 => aap.dialog_attributes) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Page `%0` (app %1, page %2) has a hardcoded tab index', 
        p0 => aap.page_name, 
        p1 => aap.application_id,
        p2 => aap.page_id) issue_title,
       aap.page_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aap.page_name,
       aap.page_mode,
			 aap.dialog_attributes,
			 aap.workspace
from aap
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aap.application_id
where aap.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
test.explanation:
It is inadvisable to alter the default tabindex of elements on a page because it can cause the experience between the sighted and unsighted users to diverge.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  2.4.3(A) : Focus Order : If a Web page can be navigated sequentially and the navigation sequences affect meaning or operation, focusable components receive focus in an order that preserves meaning and operability.
